channel.title: Peoples on Gioele La Manno
channel.description: Recent content in Peoples on Gioele La Manno

item.title: Lada Polyakova
item.description: Blurb I am a PhD student in the Computational and Quantitative Biology Program (EDCB) at EPFL, working in the La Manno Lab.

item.title: Evangelia Skoufa
item.description: Blurb I am the lab technician for the La Manno Lab at EPFL, supporting the team with experimental work and laboratory operations.

item.title: Laura Lapeña Gil
item.description: Blurb I am a PhD student in the Neuroscience Program (EDNE) at EPFL, working in the La Manno Lab.

item.title: Alireza Gargoorimothlag
item.description: Blurb I am a PhD student in the Neuroscience Program (EDNE) at EPFL, working in the La Manno Lab on computational approaches for understanding brain development.

item.title: Morgane Storey
item.description: Blurb I am a joint PhD student in the Neuroscience Program (EDNE) between the La Manno Lab and Prof. Petersen’s lab at EPFL.

item.title: Xinyi Huang
item.description: Blurb I am a PhD student in the Biotechnology and Bioengineering Program (EDBB) at EPFL, working in the La Manno Lab.

item.title: Luca Fusar Bassini
item.description: Blurb I am an happy PhD student

item.title: Alessandro Valente
item.description: Blurb I am a joint PhD student in the Neuroscience Program (EDNE) between the La Manno and D’Angelo Labs. I have a strong interest in the applications of statistical models and data analysis to the health sciences. After completing my Bachelor’s degree in McGill University, Canada in Biology and Mathematics and my M. Eng in Bioengineering at EPFL, during which I completed an internship in the La Manno Lab, I returned to the lab full time as a PhD student.

item.title: Rosan Hans
item.description: Blurb I am an Industrial PhD student in the Biotechnology and Bioengineering Program (EDBB) at EPFL, working jointly with the La Manno Lab and Roche IHB, supervised by Dr. Giuliana Rossi.

item.title: Albert Dominguez Mantes
item.description: Blurb I am a joint PhD student in the Neuroscience Program (EDNE) between the La Manno and the Weigert Lab. I have a strong interest in the applications of statistical models and data analysis to the health sciences.

item.title: Antonio Herrera Camacho
item.description: Blurb I am an happy postdoc.

item.title: Master Students
item.description: Current Master Students Francesco Danese - Visiting Student (Italy) Zeineb Mellouli - EPFL Life Sciences Engineering Lothar - Master Student

item.title: Open Positions
item.description: Openings and available projects Postdoctoral and PhD student positions There are no open positions at the moment. Outstanding candidates might still be considered, to enquires please contact me at gioele.lamanno@epfl.ch. For Ph.D. students, while direct enquiries are appreciated, to become a Ph.D. student in the lab an official application needs to go through official channels of EPFL-SV doctoral schools: EDNE, EDCB or EDMS. PhD recruitment happens only twice per year, so if interested please keep an eye on the application deadlines.

item.title: Gioele La Manno
item.description: Bio I earned my PhD at Karolinska Instituet and I am proud alumnus of the Linnarsson Lab. My original training is in Biotechnology (BSc @UNIPA) and Biomedicine (MSc @KI) but nowadays I will probably turn around if somebody is calling out for a Molecular Biologist, Computational Biologist or Bioinformatician. My research focuses on understanding brain development. I am particularly interested in describing the sequence of states that embryonic stem cells go through during their differentiation towards mature neurons.
